review_title: FAST 'N' EASY ONE-WAY TRIP  TO LOSE YOUR LICENSE, DIGNITY & SANITY
pros: 36+ hrs/week schedule, down time, well maintained facilities
cons: Job description posted for position, immediately changes verbatim after you come to work first day. Responsibilities (requiring specific medical training and certification by licensed medical provider) are given to untrained non-medical staff with a history of repetitive medication errors and who are unwilling to train. Disorganization at it's grandest display (from medical records to staff responsibilities). Toxic and unethical environment staff-staff, and unfortunately, staff-residents as well. Very heartbreaking. Higher management is a joke. Don't waste your time and risk your license here.

cons: Lacks room for growth and development. No room to move ahead in the agency.

job_title: Case Manager in New York, NY
pros: Provides you with hands-on experience with mental health disorders if you're looking to strengthen your resume for graduate school.
cons: High caseloads, high turnover rates, high burnout. Not much help from upper management. Low pay for the amount of work we do.

pros: There are no pros for this agency
cons: Everything about the agency is a negative

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Queens Village, NY
pros: Substantial work experience for someone who has never worked in social services, especially if you need to add some bulk to your resume.    A lot of training sessions are available.   Sufficient vacation/sick leave time accruals.
cons: Unfairly low salary does not match the intense workload, field work, and caseload documentation that ICL piles onto the case managers.   Asking for an increase in pay is met with diversion and a lack of compromise.   Favoritism, not unbiased work ethic and qualifications, plays a major role in who gets promoted.   Office bullying occurs right under supervisors noses, and in some cases, condoned.   Nefarious gossip in the office leads to socially awkward communication.   Cliquish behavior being encouraged by so-called "leaders" of programs.   Medical insurance costs are insanely high.

job_title: Criminal Justice Worker in Brooklyn, NY
pros: staff strives to continue working together in order to get through a trying day.
cons: the people placed in management at the long island city office are incompetent and inexperienced inflicting harm and danger to the staff and clients.

pros: None. A total waste of effort and time
cons: Many. Do not apply there.

job_title: Social Worker in New York, NY
pros: Lots to learn in different departments
cons: No raise or bonuses. Financial decisions are made by people not running the program.

pros: Pretty good supervisors and adequate pay
cons: No overtime and certain responsibilities fall on employees that shouldn't

review_title: Amazing and Horrific at the same time!
pros: Their mission is great but often sidetracked due to the culture of medicaid reimbursement.  The population is great to work with and you learn a lot when it comes to dealing with the poor, and chronically mentally ill.  Pay is decent in comparison to other agencies, but poor when compared to the amount of work expected of you.
cons:
The services given to clients fall short because of quotas needed in order to make enough money from medicaid in order to keep the doors open.

You are promised a caseload (it's even in the job description) of 15 to 20 clients, and you end up with close to 40... 

the paperwork involved with each client on a monthly basis is so extreme that you often don't have time to do actual clinical work with clients who so desperately need it.

High turnover rate, although if you can manage to stay here a year or so you'll be promoted if you're a team player (not necessarily because you're a good social worker, but because you don't make noise, don't complain, and buy into everything they tell you)

job_title: Evening Residential Counselor in New York, NY
pros: At ICL, you have the opportunity to help people who are sick, homeless, substance users and etc. Sometimes you may find yourself making decisions,  and taking on roles and duties of a supervisor. The experience is worth it for possible future endeavors.
cons: The staff at the residence, are very unprofessional. There are so many unrelated personal emotions, that causes friction for other individuals/staff comfortable to complete any task or job duty as required. There's also a lack of communication amongst the supervisors and the the staff who provide minimum support to the clients. The case managers do not speak appropriately to the skill builders/residential counselors. Last, but not least favoritism is a crucial role for this company, which causes the possibility to move up within th organization impossible.

job_title: Direct Support Professional in Bronx, NY
pros: You can drive the individuals(patients) out for the day with company van.
cons: The best  supervisor I worked with quit, then lots of other staff quit. Management pretends to care for the individuals. Any little thing management find fault quick to blame staff but Supplies were not stocked, days without food in the fridge. Managers came in one day out of the week and spoke with nasty attitudes, no greeting or good compliments from them. Days with no gloves, paper towels or soap. Horrible unprofessional experience. $11/hr is not worth taking care of these sickly individuals cooking, cleaning, doing their laundry, lifting them, bathing them restraining them when they’re out of hand and No security. Every day was a new policy. And new budget cuts, left some people to work two days out the week with bi weekly pay. How can anyone survive? Terrible company

pros: If someone is looking for an opportunity to really grow and make changes in Human Services and the mental health community then ICL is great for that.
cons:
The administration and many of the VP's that assist in running the organization are horrible and in many cases only have their best interest in mind.  The executive office is run like a popularity contest and it is almost impossible for growth because if one doesn't play "the game" they are targeted and let go of.  The HR department is no help what so ever and seem to only be a tool to move people in and out as quickly and quietly as possible.
The PARS and Supervision system is a joke only there as a psychological technique for employees to feel they have a voice but nothing comes of those things.
There are no bonuses (unless you are an exec). 
For mid or low level people I would never recommend working in ICL's executive office.

review_title: It was a learning experience that showed me how people could have no drive to live.
job_title: Case Manager Supervisor in Brooklyn, NY
pros: I enjoyed working there due to the fact that I know how it feel for people to turn their backs on you as well as a person having no drive to live. Working at ICL  gave me hope in my life as I shared my struggles and enactive with the client to give them and show that they aren't the only the ones that go through lifes up and downs.
cons: Getting the clients to out of their comfort zone to try new things, the desire to want more out of life and that people do care.

job_title: Case Manager in Queens Village, NY
pros: Helping people is always a great thing, you can get a lot of overtime especially if they are short staffed, if they messed up on your check and you show them proof it gets fixed.
cons: Management was not too friendly and made it hard to speak up about wrong doings, no job security, no Union, salary is low, trying to move up was a hassle, calling out sick would get you penalized, no recognition of staff that does a good job.

review_title: My experience with ICL was unforgettable.
pros:
The best reason hands down was; working with adolescent consumers with mental disorders. 
Also assisting consumers in reaching their goals. There's nothing better than seeing and knowing these young adults accomplish their goals. The consumers can and always will put a smile on your face.......if they believe your genuine and if they trust and like you.
cons: The senior staff are not professional and make decisions off of personal feelings not professional.  They fabricate to save themselves and don't do any of their own work but takes the credit. This was just Coney Island Facility. I believe they should close this facility because it's corrupt!

pros: Non-for-profit so 13 paid Holidays, 3 personal days, 3 sick days/ trimester, 20 vacation days if exempt, 15 if non-exempt. Health benefits including dental, HCR, and other benefits such as pre-tax commuter benefits, and dependable care reimbursement.
cons: Poor career advancement, very burocratic, employees and management do not understand the words "team-work", nobody takes responsibility, low paying jobs expecting Master's degree and above, managers often openly gossip about subordinates with other subordinates, condescending management. Healthcare cost keeps on increasing for the employees.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Challenging atmosphere, great work environment, nice people.
cons: The upper management team has lots of ghosts and nobody trusts anyone else. The C-Level people are a bunch of liers who wouldn't know the truth if it hit them in the face. They are each in it for their own gain and not the best interest of the agency.

pros: Great team, work ethic, support by supervisor and team. Love working with the consumers who are challenging but very appreciative of the hard work we do daily to ensure they are safe and are successful. Flexibility, time off and school incentives.
cons: Sometimes corporate office forgets about local programs, not located at Broad Street -- we matter to. Make sure to keep yourself involved with your satellite programs.

review_title: Decent job for students who need a job to work with their busy schedule.
pros:
Everyone works together to ensure that the individuals are well taken care of.

I also love the frequent trainings and staff meeting that help ensure the   all staff members are up-to-date and on the same page with everything that is going on in the workplace.
cons:
At times, the scheduling of shifts can be a little disorganized.
I don't see any opportunities for career advancement within this organization.

job_title: Assistant Program Manager in New York, NY
pros: The agency has a lot services available for many families in the New York City area. Teams are of specialized backgrounds and highly experienced.
cons: Salaries are not competitive and are way on low scale. Forces many an employee to look for greener pastures elsewhere. Job responsibilities are overwhelming and at my HR orientation my job description was a two page detail document out lining what seem like three positions collapsed into one.

review_title: If you want a career with respect & decent pay....then don't work here
job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Brooklyn, NY
pros: Lots of locations and sites  housing has 24 hour shifts
cons: Employees not treated with respect  Management is terrible Working at risk with some mental health populations  thankless job company changes policy often to benefit itself without consideration to clients or workers

job_title: Social Services Case Manager in Long Island City, NY
pros: As exasperated as I am, I am thankful for the chance and opportunity I have had to have work with this company. it have been a life changing experience. Great perks. I learned a lot while I was there. My co-workers were interested and fun to deal with.
cons: Needed more training in the field of case management. And less aggression in Senior Management. Employees needed to be treated with respect.

pros: I was able to fulfill  my passion to assist the Underserved population with sustaining in sobriety and attain coping skills for stability with their mental health disorders.
cons: There was limited communication with Administrative staff and employees

job_title: Human Resources Generalist in New York, NY
pros: The warding feeling of knowing how meaningful your job was. Putting the right people in the right places to serve the clients .
cons: Company needs to move with the times . Change is needed in every and all aspect of the organization.  This will benefit the clients and the employees you reply on to serve them.

review_title: All That Glitters is NOT Gold
pros:
Good reputation.
They're afraid to fire anyone, so you have a safe job.
cons:
Reputation is way over-rated.
Poor pay.  Overwork.  
If you don't "fit in" you're ostracized.  Promotions happen only if you do "fit in".
Middle management is incompetent. Upper management trusts middle management without getting to know who middle management is supervising.

cons: Getting residents who are not interested in wan t to look for employment when you still have to service the resident.

review_title: Great learning experience, leadership wasn't so great.

review_title: Do yourself a favor: don't work at ICL
